chapter.title: &SDK; Overview
chapter.para: &COMPANYABBR; provides the &SDK; as a convenient option for Java programmers when developing applications that use the &RESTAPI;. This documentation covers setting up and using the Java SDK.
Before you can access the SDK, you'll need to do the following:

listitem.para: Have a developer account with the &COMPANYABBR; as described in .

Register your application so that you can use in your development environment. See
for application registration in a Sandbox development environment, and see
for Production application registration.

chapter.para: Note the following values configured or assigned during the application registration process. You'll need these when using the SDK:

listitem.para: apiURL - The base URL of where the &RESTAPI; is hosted. The URLs of all REST API requests will be relative to this URL. This will be in the form $BASE_URL/api/rest/v1/.
clientId - A unique ID of the client assigned during application registration.
clientSecret - A cryptographically secure secret shared between the client and the REST API service, assigned alongside the client ID during application registration.

callbackURL - If you're developing a web application, this is the URL where you're currently hosting the application. During development, this is likely a persistent test server location that's running your application.

note.title: Java Version Required for the SDK
note.para: The SDK requires Java version 6 or later. The library has been created and tested with JDK 6.
